I actually think Geomancers are underpowered
Maybe they're cowardly and prefer to attack from far away.
No, I think doing 3 missions is good for disenchanting items. I don't think players should be able to disenchant and re-enchant as much as they want.
Atleast they reduced the blacksmith price!
379435782071 Yeah I guess, that's true!! Also its not as much as they want, there's a price of emeralds.
It should also do something to Nether mobs since they should be fireproof. Maybe just increased damage?
I would find that so cool to do! Problem is though, the weapons are made to shred mobs... If a battle was between two players, the battles would end almost instantly.
I think it would be better and more entertaining if just the weapons, artifacts, and armor were added in the base game(Minecraft). I like the idea of mini games though.

I do not mean to insult you or your religion but I am atheist. I highly doubt the Mojang team will put this idea into action because it would involve them in religion. I am not religious but I do find religion interest but I have also noticed that tweaking a business or game to suit a particular religion is a really bad idea. Other religions get offended lawsuits get placed and the business is shut down. Once again I am sorry if I have offended you in any way.
the only other word that they could use that makes sense would be spirits but i think that would be even worst

https://www.minecraft.net/en-us/article/new-dungeons-dlc-and-more-september-8

We’re also rolling out a free game update on September 8 that will include some fresh features: new merchants and Daily Trials. Save captured Merchants you encounter as you play the game and they’ll be so grateful that they’ll set up shop in your camp! The Blacksmith will upgrade items for you, and the Gift Wrapper will allow you to trade items with other players in multiplayer. The Merchants can also be levelled up for additional stock. The Daily Trials will provide fun new challenges every day! Daily Trials make wild changes to the game mechanics which provide difficult, experimental, or fun challenges for you to overcome.

Thanks for your feedback!

dude... calm down. Mojang is probably not gonna remove the soul mechanic of the game because that is going to make them seem religious and thereby make other religions angry or frustrated, or heck even some developers might get frustrated. (I am sorry if I offended you or your religon in any way [I'm also christian btw])

The Chief

---

Souls are often misunderstood by those outside of the Christian faith. Mojang doesn't know they're literally teaching kids to sell souls. It's evil, but like this guy here I don't think they'll change it because they're a part of some very anti-Christian groups (woke agenda & such). But, there's always a little something people put in movies & games nowadays. I'd recommend someone just start a Christian Minecraft channel that explains to kids that the whole selling souls thing is wrong. Honestly, that'd be perfect, and it's probably the best thing we can do right now.
Good idea!
That would be interesting to have... What about cloud creepers or skeletons?
What if the diamond/gold bandalore’s attack was a spin forward and backward?
I dont understand. What do you mean?
What I mean is that one of the bandalores could have an attack that spins forward like you said, and then the bandalore bounces back and spins behind the player. It's a bit like swirling.
Yes, I would love that too, although it could be a little op with the golden one

I mean it sounds great but it not look great and it’s starting to sound a bit like Terraria (but who says that’s a bad thing) I personally would love it but don’t think Mojang (Despite being as good as they are ) could make it look good or even make it work 8) best wishes with this amazing idea.

absolutely agree with this idea, you might need to work around some things like polar bears, as they add a layer of difficulty in avoiding attacking them. for that I suggest making animals invisible, but can still respawn to damage, like angry polar bears, and ocelots who hide and stop attacking creepers for a while.

p.s. also, killing animals is actually completely unnecessary, you just need to know the alternatives that exist in the game. this goes for leather too. with out killing or bartering from piglins (who do the killing for you). you can find books from strongholds and even items frames in the end city ships. Killing in minecraft is an optional choice the player makes to get ahead at the expense of moral. (though when does anyone cares about what is right and wrong in a video game.)
This would be great for teaching kids to be more compassionate to animals and climate conscious as well as being more inclusive of vegans and vegetarians.

meanwhile i'm slaughtering like 40 pandas in a level where i'm supposed to save 10 LMAO

maybe this could be added for the panda level for people who dont wanna accidentally kill pandas while  they are supposed to be saving them (unlike me) but don't increase any drop chances because usually when theres animals theres not 2000 mobs so the food is kinda worthless anyways unless ur low, meanwhile having increased food from mobs will probably help during hard moments.
Why not call it a stone golem or a moss golem?
@gas powered pick because moss boss sounds more uniqe and fun. it also rymes.
Ther already is in xbox, I think because once, I wore amour with 3 enchantments on it and something popped up.
399889255312 Ricochet is a bow enchantment

This could also have the addition of trading and cost. Where you can trade items of equal value, or if we were to purchase these items, they would come at a higher cost. For example, buying it with anonymity would be around 90 emerald, where as purchasing it while knowing what the item is would be about 350 emerald.

It definitely needs some sort of buff but you'd have to make it significantly better than just 3% if you ever want it to compete with radiance. Maybe it gives a certain amount of overheal or maybe both the healing after kill and life steal effects at once
Yup, leech is never picked for my group.
Maybe this is where you could get requests from the villagers you rescue from different levels. They might ask for weapons, armor, artifacts, or emeralds in exchange for the cool items.

https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360067850611-Add-A-Quest-Bounty-Master-?page=1#community_comment_360010939131 

This idea would work great with your idea.
Maybe there could also be raids as a daily/weekly mission on your map near Squid Coast.

I'm fine with the final boss doing tons of damage, but the problem is that bosses use all their abilities at the start of the fight. I think bosses should start easy, then become more difficult as the fight progresses. To balance this out, bosses would also have more health.
Use the shield totem, it blocks all lasers from the boss
Learn his attacks and you'll eventually find that he's too easy. ;)

The bossfight really is ok. He does a lot of damage, but you can easily avoid it, with things (I don't want to spoil someone the fight). Also the boss don't have to much HP.

The real problem is, that you can die through the boss after you've defeat him
It is the final boss for a reason though. It challenges you to be more strategic rather than running straight in.
I disagree. I beat the final boss on my first try (on all 3 difficulties too). You just have to find higher-level equipment, my guy.
This already exists. It is the same as in the camp.

I recently purchased the bundle that includes Minecraft, Dungeons, and Legends. I was sad to see no Switch 2 support and no news of it. Really hope they do get around to optimizing the series for the new console.
There could also be a trial chambers level with the breeze as a boss!
